name: irremovable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
impossible to remove: I could never trust someone who would make irremovable marks in a library book. The country's judges are professional, permanent, and irremovable.
More examplesFewer examplesIn Gandhi's view, caste was an inherent, irremovable part of Hindu society that needed only to be reformed. An irremovable stain of suspicion has been cast by police, and broadcast by the media, even before any charges have been made.These two issues remained as seemingly irremovable areas of tension for the next twenty years.
